QuestionStem: Which statement explains why the water in the South Pacific gyre begins to warm up as it moves away from the coast of South America?

options.AnswerText: A. It receives more energy from the sun.
B. It receives more rainfall from the atmosphere.
options.Feedback: Rain would not necessarily warm ocean water.

options.AnswerText: C. It loses more heat energy to the atmosphere.
options.Feedback: Losing heat would make the water colder and not warmer.

FinalIncorrectFeedback: The water in the South Pacific Gyre warms up as it moves north and west because Earth receives more energy from the sun at locations closer to the equator.
